video.title: Inflation Data
video.description: Looking at actual sequential and year-over-year inflation data.

problemSets.question: Does the United States Bureau of Labour Statistics publish Consumer Price Index (CPI) reports every month?
How does subtracting food and energy from the basket of goods and services benefit accuracy?

choices.answer: Food and energy prices are nearly consistent year-over-year which decreases the inflation.
Food and energy fluctuate more than other items (in the basket), subtracting them reflects more consistent information.

problemSets.question: Can using the Consumer Price Index (CPI) information help you with making smarter investments?

choices.answer: No, because it informs you of changes that occurred in the past which doesn’t help you understand the future.
Yes, because you can be informed of how certain industries are growing.
No, because the information isn’t accurate enough.
